definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: The marketplace is noisy and dirty.
sentences.chinese: 这个市场既吵杂又脏乱。

sentences.english: Grandma blame home mess, guess what had to the side wipe rand cope with her.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶责备家里脏乱，猜猜只好边擦地边应付她。

sentences.english: And a dirty desk is even worse.
sentences.chinese: 脏乱差的办工桌就更糟糕了。

sentences.english: In the battle between messy and tidy, which side should win?
sentences.chinese: 在脏乱与整洁之间的大战中，哪一方该获胜呢？

sentences.english: The son and daughter-in-law became irritated with the mess.
sentences.chinese: 儿子和儿媳妇为眼前的脏乱感到非常的恼火。

sentences.english: The children have mucked the whole room up.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把房间弄得脏乱不堪。

sentences.english: Being able to keep cool when he makes the floors dirty just after you've cleaned them.
sentences.chinese: 刚拖完的地板被他踩的脏乱不堪时，你却不发火。

sentences.english: Anna: Night markets are so clean now. They used to be so dirty.
sentences.chinese: 现在的夜市好干净噢，以前都还很脏乱。

sentences.english: Hospitals are decades out of date, short-staffed and filthy.
sentences.chinese: 医院设备落伍了几十年，人员短缺，环境脏乱。

sentences.english: My flatmate is very messy, but I still put up with him.
sentences.chinese: 我的室友很脏乱，但我还是忍让他。

sentences.english: They are so lazy that their dorm room is always the dirtiest one.
sentences.chinese: 他们很懒，宿舍总是脏乱差第一。

sentences.english: In the garden, wreathed in filth, stood the ugly girl, cuddling a child.
sentences.chinese: 在脏乱的花园里站着丑女孩，抱着一个孩子。

sentences.english: They look down upon the stage platform, thinks dirty, noisy and disorder, has destructiveness to the play.
sentences.chinese: 他们看不起戏楼，觉得脏乱差，对戏剧具有破坏性。

sentences.english: Messy classrooms are Dr. J's pet peeves.
sentences.chinese: 脏乱的教室是J博士最气恼的事。

definition: messy hair and dirty face/bad appearance
